meanings.definition: Having a sour or sharp taste resembling that of vinegar or lemon juice.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar had an acidy flavor.
meanings.sent3: The acidy candy made her pucker up.
meanings.sent4: The acidy smell of the pickles filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The acidy taste of the salad dressing lingered on her tongue.

meanings.definition: Containing acid or having a high concentration of acid.
meanings.sent1: The acidy solution burned through the metal.
meanings.sent2: The battery fluid was very acidy.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled the acidy cleaner on her shoes.
meanings.sent4: The acidy rain eroded the statue over time.
meanings.sent5: The scientist wore gloves to protect his skin from the acidy substance.
